DataElement.preferredName: Person Post Intervention Biological Response Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of the type of biological response achieved by a person after an intervention.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Post Intervention Biological Response Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A single human being._Post; occuring after._Activity or measure that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in patient or population. This is a general term encompassing medical, social, behavioral, environmental and other acts that can have preventive and/or therapeutic impact._Pertaining to biology or to life and living things._In medicine, an improvement related to treatment._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being.:Post; occuring after.:An action or ministration that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:In medicine, a substance made from living organisms or things they produce, such as a vaccine. Some biologicals stimulate or restore the ability of the immune system to fight infection and disease.:In medicine, an improvement related to treatment.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
An action or ministration that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
Pertaining to biology or to life and living things.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University adoption of C3D

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: In medicine, a substance made from living organisms or things they produce, such as a vaccine. Some biologicals stimulate or restore the ability of the immune system to fight infection and disease._In medicine, an improvement related to treatment._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Some biologicals stimulate or restore the ability of the immune system to fight infection and disease.: In medicine, an improvement related to treatment.

The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.
